ED01C134D3FA4565B7339E8C7DC9F849.description: SCSR.B.13.g: critically discuss the results and conclusions of a colleague's research experiment

42A521E4BD004A7B84D43A0F063E8238.description: SCSR.B.13.f: present and receive feedback from the scientific community on an original research idea

9119E413A58243EAB203A55DF25B53ED.description: SCSR.B.13.e: demonstrate knowledge of funding guidelines by applying for a grant or scholarship

5DA6A880BDF34303B5A3B02B791F58A7.description: SCSR.B.13.d: explore the public and private agencies that financially support and promote career and education in the sciences

E38B7BE8B36C4E7C917D207733FC9629.description: SCSR.B.13.c: explore and discuss the public and private agencies that regulate research practices at local, national, and international levels

A7BA66BFB4B142F9AB626125255239B5.description: SCSR.B.13.b: demonstrate the ability to summarize scientific literature in order to provide rationale for a proposed experiment

A2DFC9A838944C86B0E1B691F2B422C6.description: SCSR.B.13.a: recognize the required design and approval stages of experimental research in order to receive grant funding and publish data in a peer-reviewed journal

74B109546A184E48A39C7EF43F785092.description: SCSR.B.13: explore the scope of funding, professional development, and collaboration within the scientific research community

2D9B69044EC44C62A893360014F3BE74.description: SCSR.B.12.g: communicate experimental results and conclusions, clearly and effectively, by constructing graphs, tables, and charts for presentation

0C663D4AB1EC40D5B17658CBFB85FDCC.description: SCSR.B.12.f: participate in group discussions on scientific investigations and literature

196EC95010A6449381B0F693CE4657A3.description: SCSR.B.12.e: use data as evidence to support conclusions in written and oral presentations

E3E5736C265145459F561899D82EEDB9.description: SCSR.B.12.d: write clear, coherent research documents related to scientific research, including experimental protocols and laboratory summaries

5F4DA253CBF542F9B4FCA676DFA5D557.description: SCSR.B.12.c: assess the quality of data critically for possible sources of error or bias

3CFD67112D52495EA65F57A2C8600DAA.description: SCSR.B.12.b: evaluate whether conclusions are reasonable by reviewing the processes used to collect and analyze the data, comparing the results to scientific literature, and seeking feedback from a mentor scientist

406CC40E0EF24E2795B591755D0073E2.description: SCSR.B.12.a: develop reasonable conclusions that are based on statistically significant data observations

DEFA0ED884714BC881D0BA5B101CEEA5.description: SCSR.B.12: clearly communicate the results and conclusions of a research-based scientific investigation

5CC6440849224667931CCEC7252A68CC.description: SCSR.B.11.i: recognize that testing and revising an experimental protocol is a continuous process in research

0AFBF54947144E97A6601B56809C9BF6.description: SCSR.B.11.h: use quantitative and qualitative data analysis to critique protocols, draw conclusions, and modify the experimental protocol when necessary

2D9C198800D6492D962E37D3C1A229EF.description: SCSR.B.11.g: examine the possible effects of equipment, measurement, or operator errors

75507F374A7B45298EF7DC55259FBA46.description: SCSR.B.11.f: analyze and evaluate data, using appropriate statistical methods, in order to validate data, make inferences or predictions, and identify trends, patterns, and proportional relationships

4428999701AE4C00AAE9C459FE8E507F.description: SCSR.B.11.e: display all data with appropriate scientific notation and significant figures

9815CCA70B9C4D83B7B8013D118B46F6.description: SCSR.B.11.d: organize and record data in a legal scientific notebook

44E14D3ACE64447BA205BAECEFFD5BAD.description: SCSR.B.11.c: follow correct protocols for laboratory techniques and safety procedures that have been established by the mentor and/or created throughout the experimental design process

74498AD1296F4D56AC4B184E76A1A0FA.description: SCSR.B.11.b: demonstrate proficiency in laboratory techniques used throughout the research process

120DEC11031C4EFCBE383768760D619E.description: SCSR.B.11.a: use appropriate technology, techniques, and equipment to collect scientific data in various ways

714FDF5CD70946BCB850615DBDCF4F25.description: SCSR.B.11: conduct a complete, research-based scientific investigation including obtaining and documenting accurate data, performing data analysis, critiquing and modifying experimental protocols, and report findings

0033039ACB854C1C8FF692F27F867A1C.description: SCSR.B.10.f: complete and submit required forms and products according to university and school-level requirements

6E281568D484495FAD29F78EC8C8D7D6.description: SCSR.B.10.e: design methods based on safe and ethical practices

1415FB6EB38B4F5CAF991D9C1058F949.description: SCSR.B.10.d: select appropriate materials and equipment to ensure experiments can be completed accurately and safely

E4F3D88173F04C268D572A773BB3DE4F.description: SCSR.B.10.c: develop and implement ethical experimental procedures and protocols for solving a scientific problem and testing a hypothesis

6873310FCF2D4DA79FADA5B042D43F48.description: SCSR.B.10.b: suggest testable hypotheses for an identified scientific problem

923878E6237742C780BBE4F5812D4F49.description: SCSR.B.10.a: utilize background research from credible scientific sources to develop a testable question

A3CE4CB1A241434CB524BF5C28ACE18D.description: SCSR.B.10: using knowledge obtained from scientific literature, design an ethical research-based experimental project that investigates questions or problems that can be answered through scientific inquiry

C70AB30A79BB480C828898F26DEACF12.description: SCSR.B.9.g: conduct collaborative efforts in a professional manner

C8C6ACF54D604C459EA4C80A477D8B3E.description: SCSR.B.9.f: provide evidence of collaboration with a mentor by submitting monthly timesheets, supervisor evaluations, and written summaries of how mentor feedback has been incorporated into the research design

30F9049F87754BE58621BCF3B62077F8.description: SCSR.B.9.e: create a research and career development plan for a field of science, including educational and experience milestones

8273EB94B3664481A969E7A267FA4CCE.description: SCSR.B.9.d: use various sources, including research and the mentor's knowledge and expertise, to gather information about current and future research, publication, and career opportunities

F485D3D4E2164A04B39359A0EFE58468.description: SCSR.B.9.c: ask compelling questions to obtain knowledge about a mentor's research or area of expertise

450A288AC46E4526A23A2639A5334760.description: SCSR.B.9.b: establish and maintain communication with a mentor supervisor operating in the area of scientific research

BBAF73F9B66B41CF8F9F28C9CDE4289C.description: SCSR.B.9.a: identify a field of scientific research that is of interest and determine the field's educational requirements, internship options, entry-level positions, advancement opportunities, and significance

0698827BA1DF4A4497BD6D06F9D27BD1.description: SCSR.B.9: use collaborative skills to inquire and explore research and career opportunities in science

21DA08126F994DB298CFFED1762B375E.description: SCSR.B.8.j: understand and describe the major scientific discoveries in the field, as well as their impact on both society and future research

CAC59A8FFA72424686432E60B646C761.description: SCSR.B.8.i: identify and define content-specific vocabulary presented in scientific literature and be able to use this vocabulary in writing and speech

BA3BB0D5F67E485D82E9F134F353D80E.description: SCSR.B.8.h: identify limitations and possible ethical implications within a prescribed research process and provide recommendations for modification's and additional research

ED32EE8868D44F15924A3931A03993AF.description: SCSR.B.8.g: compare and critique the relationship of a researcher's experimental hypothesis, protocol, and results to his or her conclusion

B5BEEC9A6E814278AD2BABF3248CEC34.description: SCSR.B.8.f: interpret scientific data presented in tables, graphs, and figures, as well as in written form

53970995568E446395BD8623879B6CC8.description: SCSR.B.8.e: evaluate research design presented in literature to determine the purpose for each of the procedures performed and their ethical implications

10C492F3B3FA4641AA58E9FE45D6A5B3.description: SCSR.B.8.d: identify and evaluate the scientific methodology used by a researcher

DA21625A0CF1413DBDFE5A64A2666ECE.description: SCSR.B.8.c: analyze and critique hypotheses and theories presented in the literature in order to evaluate their merits, strengths, weaknesses, and the feasibility

EE38040321DE481AA9FF169265737C74.description: SCSR.B.8.b: recognize and critique the author's purpose in writing and/or performing research

C471D08407B74DB4940ED1AD3D843447.description: SCSR.B.8.a: locate credible scientific sources and distinguish from those that are not credible

E61347E2E0CC46BA961FBDB5D205E456.description: SCSR.B.8: read credible, peer-reviewed scientific literature to recognize and understand the elements of ethical scientific research; develop vocabulary and subject-related content knowledge; and become familiar with current research in the field, as well as the implications of the research

720E5B7DDB524914864EA99CB4EACF01.description: SCSR.A.7.i: discuss the importance of curiosity, honesty, openness, and skepticism in science and exhibit these traits in efforts to understand how the world works

07D9E697DD124C1CB50BADB568E40CCF.description: SCSR.A.7.h: by the end of grade 12, read and comprehend science/technical texts in the grades 11-12 text complexity band independently and proficiently

6E3C6B2F0CAA46A1B82B2D1BA6071EE2.description: SCSR.A.7.g: analyze how the text structures information or ideas into categories or hierarchies, demonstrating understanding of the information or ideas

EAD6D11F8433432D813B2A15E5344569.description: SCSR.A.7.f: determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 11-12 texts and topics

4BD1F8AFE6C64E09918BB79A9C5D28DA.description: SCSR.A.7.e: examine relationship between life experiences and subject-area content

FDB82F43B66A45C4AF80104FA8121FFF.description: SCSR.A.7.d: apply strategies for determining content and contextual meaning for unknown words

726496AF06EF47A08BCCA997543B41CE.description: SCSR.A.7.c: use content vocabulary in writing and speaking

9A4F2F2785174D479ACD33BF47EC514C.description: SCSR.A.7.b4: examine the features of disciplinary texts

20E42950D46249FDB8C83E5819455F86.description: SCSR.A.7.b3: analyze the author's purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text, identifying important issues that remain unresolved

B43C3D4F4EDD4EC3A59ABCCCBCE77F14.description: SCSR.A.7.b2: evaluate the hypotheses, data, analysis, and conclusions in a science or technical text, verifying the data when possible and corroborating or challenging conclusions with other sources of information

9CD28561C9AA489D8BCA2C787B13F7B2.description: SCSR.A.7.b1: respond to text using multiple modes of discourse

FF9EB4ABB2A546D8906FFC64205D3A04.description: SCSR.A.7.b: discuss messages and themes from text and relate to other subject areas

3AD28DFB4F594EA586DE06FE194B5A66.description: SCSR.A.7.a2: determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; summarize complex concepts, processes, or information presented in a text by paraphrasing them in simpler, but still accurate, terms

4485E6303B284118AC3B7909E7CAEF25.description: SCSR.A.7.a1: read technical text related to various subject areas (GPS)

48C6AE1E8B24499E8D1DEEE0BDD9320E.description: SCSR.A.7.a: read grade-level appropriate text (both informational and fictional) from a variety of genres and modes of discourse

866457A256CC45D99DAA3B3C3E864DB8.description: SCSR.A.7: read scientific materials to establish context for subject matter, to develop vocabulary, and to be aware of current research

D03541BF43DF4EF49ABEF7BBD2B1F26D.description: SCSR.A.6.k: write routinely over extended time frames (time for reflection and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences

9B59BF77EF39409F8C4FD3C5868A8B10.description: SCSR.A.6.j: gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the strengths and limitations of each source in terms of the specific task, purpose, and audience; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and overreliance on any one source and following a standard format for citation

BCF7355E86114ACE9DCDBDBE8162AA7C.description: SCSR.A.6.i: use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback, including new arguments or information

4C9F09FD8E874AD5A695101BE80FD2BA.description: SCSR.A.6.h: develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience

E095F1E13E0A4E8FB18FCB330AAFC166.description: SCSR.A.6.g: produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

3FA1D47AAB3D4D4B9E5C4FDBFAC299B3.description: SCSR.A.6.f: integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., quantitative data, video, multimedia) in order to address a question or solve a problem

DF0E56A444E04E588B82C9B31893B19B.description: SCSR.A.6.e: use peer reviews to analyze accuracy of scientific writings/reports

6FF00C81DCC54860BEA0EC8843F40B9D.description: SCSR.A.6.d: participate in group discussions of scientific investigations and current scientific issues

BF6367D534CB461C97B20397519E2A33.description: SCSR.A.6.c3: provide a concluding statement or section that follows from or supports the argument presented

9EC7B3902C2240EE8AA4D8FC9C6542E9.description: SCSR.A.6.c2: evaluate strengths and limitations of claims and counterclaims

9989770528654478972ED7811961463A.description: SCSR.A.6.c1: organize information in order to establish clear relationships between scientific arguments, reasons, and evidence

4CFC82B1F43349FF9A55C5CED78A0433.description: SCSR.A.6.c: in written or oral presentations, use evidence, including data, to support scientific arguments and claims, and present possible alternative interpretations

A0A379B7D3DC424F9D5CDF796756E834.description: SCSR.A.6.b5: provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic)

EB7C5E8A0DA94C8CB839130C7981A6DF.description: SCSR.A.6.b4: establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which one is writing

579CED85245841188B24047402CDB7C9.description: SCSR.A.6.b3: use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to manage the complexity of the topic and convey a style appropriate to the discipline and context as well as to the expertise of likely readers

4C16442708F74175AEB6E46A6ECFBA25.description: SCSR.A.6.b2: support topic by using relevant facts, domain-specific vocabulary, and appropriate data representation, including graphics, tables, charts, and figures to aid comprehension

010AF3215FF84A0AABB8EC2145408C66.description: SCSR.A.6.b1: develop topic by organizing ideas, making important connections and linking and clarifying relationships

56D87EF52A81450C8D37314127C2883F.description: SCSR.A.6.b: write clear, coherent accounts connecting scientific content including: procedures/experiments and current and historical scientific issues

5BA89F395D1C4C8FB91B04BB8A4CB5C4.description: SCSR.A.6.a: write clear, coherent laboratory reports related to scientific investigations

4543671BC2A44AE480F2E0766A6F9CD7.description: SCSR.A.6: communicate scientific information, ideas, and arguments clearly

F100C59A66B84A50B645A2A7CE6AE014.description: SCSR.A.5.f: compare and analyze data points graphically and/or with summary statistics

4AEDAC293A7E4BBB8F50022BA4E0C77C.description: SCSR.A.5.e: solve scientific problems by substituting quantitative values, using dimensional analysis and/or simple algebraic functions as appropriate

02F837FEF380446A9CD91E76149415A8.description: SCSR.A.5.d: express the appropriate number of significant figures for calculated data, using scientific notation where appropriate

98E7DD4D9B9C4514B2776AA82E6AB02C.description: SCSR.A.5.c: explain the relationship between accuracy and precision

4F0BE8DAB07D4F549BD1D8D827180EB7.description: SCSR.A.5.b1: relate the number of significant figures to precision of measuring instrument

DC53F71776FE44B8AAC91949F95CE4E6.description: SCSR.A.5.b: examine the possible effects of measurement errors on calculations

3B445883A2214280B6DD2DE66E50D189.description: SCSR.A.5.a: determine the source of large disparities between estimated and calculated results

98C08C12B4EF4B63AB8CAE6DFAA205CB.description: SCSR.A.5: apply computation and estimation skills necessary for analyzing data and developing conclusions

04868FCCFFA54763BD1A8FFDF43B1D95.description: SCSR.A.4.h: draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research

953918A294204C5CB4A564A3FA3168F6.description: SCSR.A.4.g: synthesize information from a range of sources (e.g., texts, experiments, simulations) into a coherent understanding of a process, phenomenon, or concept, resolving conflicting information when possible

A33C96A2F46F468F963C6878F92B278E.description: SCSR.A.4.f: cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts, attending to important distinctions the author makes and to any gaps or inconsistencies in the account

51F4F50E66584B4BA8E9CF747BD08924.description: SCSR.A.4.e: recognize the merit of a new theory is judged by how well scientific data are explained by the new theory

8575969881BF4496835F84F04614B3CF.description: SCSR.A.4.d: distinguish among laws, theories, and inferences

9615FAD4BE654364B2CBB32E3C59A8BA.description: SCSR.A.4.c: assess the quality of data critically for possible sources of bias

9852AF5326E845428FFD35DF0FA8D210.description: SCSR.A.4.b: evaluate whether conclusions are reasonable by reviewing the process and checking against other available information

BC962EBCA514489A9C5E7AB8F5AEEE27.description: SCSR.A.4.a: develop reasonable conclusions based on data collected

A8DB73AD23DF457EB43483A2794BD3F3.description: SCSR.A.4: use valid critical assumptions to draw conclusions

47E2D8CD2CC349A79F34F653F05726F0.description: SCSR.A.3.c: use technology to develop, test, and revise experimental/mathematical models

4509DB83615F4D63B87D6E2D60D78930.description: SCSR.A.3.b: use graphical analysis software to produce tables/graphs and to determine constants in experiments

B7095DD19C7B4219B59022B58C8EB5D6.description: SCSR.A.3.a: develop and use systematic procedures for recording and organizing information

2EDCB2FA68FE480A8F5EE2316AAEB780.description: SCSR.A.3: use technology to collect, observe, measure, and analyze data and report findings

6E1C6C89DB7041F0ACAEFACF804FAC6A.description: SCSR.A.2.c: follow correct protocol for identifying and reporting safety problems and violations

F1603C019E5F4AB899B57D2145F3864F.description: SCSR.A.2.b: demonstrate appropriate techniques in all laboratory situations

A8F85DA1D3A4452695121CAB4D00F992.description: SCSR.A.2.a: follow correct procedures for use of scientific apparatus

DB784D34CB5C461FA7E28F40FD9B4096.description: SCSR.A.2: apply standard safety practices for all classroom laboratory and field investigations

8CC4267514E94AD988F8D8D60014C00F.description: SCSR.A.1.j: conduct short, as well as more sustained, research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question) or solve a problem; narrow or broaden the inquiry when appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subject, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation

AF75B7A0A15D430183799F200DDCE2DF.description: SCSR.A.1.i: follow precisely a complex multi-step procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks; analyze the specific results based on explanations in the text

FD31B5785BEE4123827AEBB88B4FD689.description: SCSR.A.1.h: recognize science disciplines differ from one another in what is studied, techniques used, and outcomes sought

A5EE1E3E607346DB8DF271DE934A2844.description: SCSR.A.1.g: examine the role of curiosity and skepticism in scientific investigation

D01F5CB3A66A4293BC98DB445BB49A76.description: SCSR.A.1.f3: recognize major shifts in scientific views typically occur after the observation of a new phenomenon or the interpretation of existing data

6F05BCA331D44BC0BDE64D7C710DE38D.description: SCSR.A.1.f2: recognize universal principles are discovered through observation and experimental verification and basic principles are the same everywhere (e.g., law of conservation of matter)

64829A35030B4053B23C8F79B8E3362B.description: SCSR.A.1.f1: recognize testing, revising, and occasionally rejecting new and existing theories is a continuous process

CBA04055D083476DA7B29907F1E764A1.description: SCSR.A.1.f: explain further understanding of scientific problems relies on the design and execution of new experiments may reinforce or weaken explanations

23E5A6B4D3944EACA9DCB6799800AD16.description: SCSR.A.1.e: recognize different explanations may be given for the same evidence

85893FFFCC084CDE859C70734DE23B1E.description: SCSR.A.1.d: collect, organize, and record appropriate data

EF02530D27B24B01969C9EDFF0B18988.description: SCSR.A.1.c1: control the conditions of scientific investigations

F43A098BF34347A8969FAE1E66F99BB0.description: SCSR.A.1.c: develop procedures for solving scientific problems

2EB2E925A4304573A8B44C30CD93437A.description: SCSR.A.1.b1: recognize hypotheses often lead to the development of new experiments

BA0DCEECA08145C4A7461F3C6677261A.description: SCSR.A.1.b: suggest hypotheses for identified problems

67C1C33546C3464DB6BD4AF313DF3B12.description: SCSR.A.1.a: identify, develop, and investigate questions/problems that can be answered through scientific inquiry

40A7D85C5A654B02B206E38B0C12A39B.description: SCSR.A.1: design and conduct scientific investigations
